analysis.Summary: This file defines a nested Vue Router route configuration for all user‐related pages under the '/users' path, including profile viewing, editing, blogposts, events, organizations and wallet.
analysis.Purpose: Serve as the central router module for user‐centric views in the auth module, wiring up paths, route metadata, guards and dynamic component imports.

Components.name: users
Components.responsibility: Root route for '/users', holds metadata (titles) and defines child routes for user profiles and sub‐sections.

Components.name: children
Components.responsibility: Nested routes under '/users/:_id' for Profile, Edit Profile, Posts, Events, Organizations and Wallet.

Functions.name: hideNavigationBar
Functions.purpose: Dynamically hide the navigation bar when the viewed profile _id matches the currently authenticated user.

Functions.name: validationAuth.requiresAuth
Functions.purpose: Route guard that checks if the user is authenticated before allowing access to the profile edit page.

Functions.name: condition
Functions.purpose: Determines if the 'Add Organization' action should be shown based on the presence of a logged‐in user.

Functions.name: action
Functions.purpose: Redirects the router to the 'Create Organization' route when the plus icon is clicked.

analysis.Usage: Imported into the main Vue Router setup (e.g. router/index.js) to be merged with other route modules. Consumers navigate to '/users/:_id/*' to access these pages.
Notes: Uses dynamic imports with webpackChunkName 'profile' to lazy‐load user profile components.
Leverages Vue Router's nested children structure and meta fields for titles and custom UI actions.
The hideNavigationBar callback references the auth store to tailor UI per logged‐in user.
